name: Let the Cat in
description: Help little kittens to get into the house, reach their favorite basket and fall asleep. To do this, you need to arrange all the things and mechanisms inside the house for creating fantastic chain reactions, in order to open the door!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows: XP, Vista, 7, 8 Processor: 1,5 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: SM2.0 (or later) Graphics Card DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Never in my Life I said '♥♥♥♥ OFF, GRANDMA, I CAN DO IT MYSELF' this often.
an old woman takes you hostage and makes you assemble rube goldberg machines to let the cat in
First we had Bad Rats. Now we have Bad Cats.
It's like Bad Rats but with cats

Are you looking for a high octane, fast paced action pacted adventure. Well you're in for a treat here this game involves teamwork, quick witts and skill as you help that poor defenceless kitty through that door. You are forced to be in a team from the very start with an old frail lady who cant be bothered to open her own door to buy a better cat flap. This game takes you to hell and back as you prepare for that rude awakening as the cat wants to be let into his home and go to bed. If only other games would make their gameplay so rich, rewarding and tasteful.  Its a gem in an old box 10/10 - IGN
So cute! There are many levels, plenty of entertainment to be had. Satisfy your craving for puzzle-solving while being creative and enjoying the cute over-load ^_^

The tag for this game is Illuminati...We dont know who let the cat in...Wait! Cat. Cat has 3 letters. This game is a rpg. Rpg has 3 letters. 3+3=6. I watched this trailer 6 times now. I cant stop please help me. Wait this trailer is 30 seconds long... I watched 3 minutes in total. A triangle has three sides. An rpg has zero sides. The illuminati has three sides and one eye shaped like an oval and 0 is shaped like an oval.

I decided to try out this brand new AAA game, developed by Eforb. This game features a very in depth storyline, one more advanced than Skyrim. With approximately 160 high intensity missions about a woman too lazy to open the door, yet is able to build a Rube Goldberg machine. The cat customisation is more in depth than that of Need For Speed 2015. Would definitely put this game up there with the ratings of Skyrim and Grand Theft Auto V. 10 out of 10. Would build a machine more complex than the TARDIS itself to let a cat inside the house.
GoodGame Ilove Cat =w= 1/10 :D Nope 8/10

All I can say is 'wow'.  Wow.  What an experience. The ambiance, the story, the character development, it all works.  Honestly, there is no way the director could have executed this story any better, a truly breath-taking story of a naive feline protagonist trying to  get in the house .  How can you beat that?  >protip, you cant
Catchy trailer tune, but I did get bored of the game. Depends on whether you like reaction puzzle games.

Although its a free game, its not decent. It took on the approch to be a crazy machine game but failed to do so and is really dull. The hints in the game aren't hints, this old lady comes along and solves the puzzle and the microtransactions are really poor. you can pay upto $20 I belive to add some sunglasses or something to that little cat which you see the side of so you can barely see the clothing on it which walks across the screen slower then someone with no legs and attempts to climb into this basket. The diffucutly isn't really there. I find i restart once or twice before solving the puzzle but crazy machines on other hand has a nice diffuculty level that isn't to easy nor very hard. another thing that annoys me is when you finish 5 levels you go up a floor, you see two floors at once but instead of a nice scrolling effect to go up 1 floor it goes there immedently and i find going to a level 5 levels ahead where im at and i get confused. even better, later on you have to use the stars you get for completing a level earlier on and spend them to unlock more, i understand if it was a requirement to have minimun of said stars but to take them away, this means if you're to intrested putting hats on your cat likes its TF2 your screwed.   If you want to play a 2D puzzle game like this, pick up crazy machines its cheap and a lot more fun.

In summary: obnoxious.  it's a nice little puzzle game, at base, and i can see that graphically it's what some might call cute (personally, i consider it more creepy). but the Meowing is obnoxious (fortunately you can turn it off), the minimum effort tablet port is obnoxious ('yes' rather than 'OK', 'tap' rather than 'click', giant buttons of doom, No Exit button, fortunately Alt+F4 works...) the tutorial which forces you to take a screen shot is annoying. it starts in windowed mode with the edges sticking off your screen. there are no resolution or full screen options in the options menu (though the ALT key saves the day again, with Alt+Enter forcing it into a proper full screen mode which does fit.) so far as i can Tell the stars you can get in the levels are spent to unlock later ones early, or random Cloathing(?!) for your cat, but it's set up in such a way as to make it quite obvious that they expect you to eventually get stuck and pay for more of them to progress (or at least do in the tablet versions, which, by the way, you can go get from the ipod or google play app stores by clicking a button in the main menu... well, supposedly. i have no interest, so haven't actually clicked those buttons. if the port continues to form, it's a toss up as to whether they work or not.)  which all sounds like a terrible review and a reason to not buy it (if it weren't free in the first place).  it kind of is. but if you can put up with all of that, the actual 'drop the ball on the book to turn the bobbin to pull the string to open the flap to let the cat in' game play works well enough.   ... and i just realised i compleatly forgot to capitalize almost everything in this review... meh.

A dull Rube Goldberg-style puzzle game. Solutions are too obvious. The contraptions aren't fun to watch at all, because they aren't complicated and because the animations are very slow. Graphics are bland and low res, not cute at all. I suggest you play Crazy machines or the incredible machine series instead.
I regret existing.  There is no way to even count how bad this game is. Imagine windows 8, free. Windows 8, with 5000 viruses, BonziBUDDY, Roblox, and brain cancer. That is what this game is.

Expecting this to be a review? Too bad.. Enjoy this delicious recipe of cooked cat.  Ingredients  1 cat ½ red onion 1 pimiento 1 clove of garlic 2 ½ dl coconut milk 2 ½ dl cream 2 tbsp meat extract Juice of lime Ginger Butter Instructions  Skin, fillet and chop the cat. Start your coffee maker, grease the heater and place the pieces of your cat onto it. Fry it until they are cooked throughly and tender, it will take about an hour (it depends on what cut of meat you’re using and how fresh it is). Remove the meat and wipe the heater.  Chop all of the remaining ingredients that shall be chopped. Put a dollop of butter into the carafe, let it melt and then put the onion and the garlic in the carafe and fry it for about half an hour. Season with ginger. Add coconut milk, cream and meat extract and let it cook for two hours – it should get really warm. After that add the cat meat and wait a bit longer. Finally add pimiento pieces, lime juice and season generously with freshly ground black pepper and just a little salt. Turn off your coffee maker.  The best way to serve this delicious cat stew is accompanied by a glass of a tasty red wine and freshly baked bread. Congrats you're done!
